title: Valley View Pitcher Strikes Out Eight In Gem Vs. Honesdale
title_page: Valley View Pitcher Strikes Out Eight In Gem Vs. Honesdale
maintext:
Valley View Pitcher Strikes Out Eight In Gem Vs. Honesdale
Mason Black felt pretty good about pitching Tuesday when the temperature was above 60 degrees.
The Valley View senior and Lehigh University commit took advantage of the conditions.
Black struck out eight and got plenty of run support — including a home run from his younger brother Dixon — to toss a five-inning perfect game in the Cougars’ 11-0 win over Honesdale in a Lackawanna League Division III game.
“Everything was working,” Black said. “Fastball, I leaned heavily on that. But it was good game overall.
“I wasn’t really thinking about it that much. It was just throwing strikes and trust my defense.”
Black admittedly became a little erratic in the last inning. With one out, he almost hit a batter, who worked the count to 3-2. Black induced a groundball back to him for the second out and then got another comebacker for the final out to nail down his gem.
Black has not allowed a run in 23 innings this season. He’s given up just eight hits, walked three and struck out 28.
Dixon Black went 3 for 4 with four RBIs. Robert Sebastianelli and Kyle Cwalinski each had two hits. Sebastianelli drove in a pair of runs.

Softball
Lindsey Leppo hit a tying home run in the top of the seventh and Gianna Sacchetti followed with a go-ahead RBI double to give Holy Cross a 7-6 win over Lakeland in a Lackawanna League Division III game.

Jessie Cunningham had two hits, including a three-run home run, for Lakeland.
